summary: The Strong Communities Act of 2025 amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to allow COPS grant funds to be used for local law enforcement recruits to attend training programs. To be eligible, recruits and officers must agree to serve in their communities for a minimum of four years within eight years of completing training. The bill also mandates the Attorney General to submit annual reports detailing grant recipients and the employment status of officers and recruits who participated in the training.
